definitions.definition: One who makes an offer to another; someone who presents something to another for acceptance or rejection .
examples: A unilateral contract consists of a promise on the part of the offeror and performance of the requisite terms by the offeree.
Acceptance of the offer terminates the power of revocation that the offeror ordinarily has.

main_definition: One who makes an offer to another; someone who presents something to another for acceptance or rejection .
